title: Dhivehi Premier League
text:
Dhivehi Premier League is a Maldivian men's professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> league. At the top of the <a href="Football%20in%20Maldives">Maldives football league system</a>, it is the country's primary football competition. Contested by 10 clubs, it operates on a system of <a href="promotion%20and%20relegation">promotion and relegation</a> with <a href="Second%20Division%20Football%20Tournament">Second Division Football Tournament</a>.
Teams are playing 14 matches each (playing each team in the league twice) totalling 56 matches in the season. The competition formed as the Dhivehi Premier League succeeded the <a href="Dhivehi%20League">Dhivehi League</a>. From 2018 onward 10 teams compete in Dhivehi Premier League.
Competition format.
Competition.
There are 10 clubs in the Premier League. During the course of a season each club plays the others twice (a double <a href="Round-robin%20tournament">round-robin system</a>), for a total of 14 games. Teams receive <a href="three%20points%20for%20a%20win">three points for a win</a> and one point for a draw. No points are awarded for a loss. Teams are <a href="Group%20tournament%20ranking%20system">ranked</a> by total points, then <a href="goal%20difference">goal difference</a>, and then goals scored. If still equal, teams are deemed to occupy the same position. If there is a tie for the championship, for relegation, or for qualification to other competitions, a play-off match decides rank.
Qualification for Asian competitions.
The top two teams in the Dhivehi Premier League qualify for the <a href="AFC%20Cup">AFC Cup</a>, with the champion directly entering the group stage. The second-placed team enters the AFC Cup at the play-off round for East Asia Zone and must win the match in order to enter the group stage.
Finances.
The <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Maldives">Football Association of Maldives</a> (FAM) provides each Premier League team with an amount of <a href="Maldivian%20rufiyaa">MVR</a> 1.6 million. The Champion team also receives a MVR 1 million cash prize.
